headline: Bacon Risotto
description: Creamy risotto is simply flavored with delicious bacon in his rich and tasty dish.

video.description: Bacon’s the star of the show in this simple risotto recipe.
video.name: Bacon Risotto

name: Bacon Risotto
recipeIngredient: salt and black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Cook and stir the diced bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until browned, about 10 minutes. Drain the bacon and reserve.
Bring the chicken stock to a boil in a saucepan over high heat; reduce heat to low to keep the chicken stock hot.

Heat 2 tablespoons butter in a large, heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the onion and garlic; cook and stir until the onion begins to turn golden brown at the edges, about 2 minutes. Pour in the rice and stir until the rice is coated in butter and has started to toast, 2 to 3 minutes. Reduce heat to medium; stir in one-third of the hot chicken stock and continue stirring until the rice has absorbed the liquid and turned creamy. Repeat this process twice more, stirring constantly. Stirring in the broth should take 15 to 20 minutes in all. When finished, the rice should be tender, yet slightly firm.
Remove the risotto from the heat and stir in the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter, the Parmesan cheese, and the reserved bacon. Season to taste with salt and pepper before serving.

review.reviewBody: This is definitely going to be in the running every time I consider making risotto. The bacon is an incredible addition and just enough outside the box to have the WOW factor. Can’t wait to use this as the risotto in my next arancini!!
Toned down butter and replaced with mascarpone as I was finishing. Was a tad more generous on Parmesan and through in some brown mushrooms and spinach. Great result, spectacular even.
Delicious. Recipe runs out of broth before rice is soft. Works better with 1-1/4 cup of rice. No salt necessary, bacon has plenty.
My husband saw this in the Allrecipes magazine several years ago. He made it that night and it has become the family’s favorite side dish!

This was so good! Very rich and filling. The only change I made was for the first 2T of butter, I only used 1T and used 1T bacon grease. It is a tad bit salty (I did not add salt at the end, only pepper), so I think next time I'll use unsalted butter. Other than that it's a keeper!

Never made risotto or used Arborio rice before. Having tried this, I will again. Like some others, I used the bacon drippings? rather than butter to ?sauté onion, garlic, & rice. I wanted this as a main dish for the two of us, so added peas, plus fresh mushrooms I needed to use up. Lots of stirring, but not otherwise difficult. Very tasty for this winter night! Thanks for the recipe.
My first risotto. I get the appeal now. + BACON! = wow.

Delicious!! Made this for New Years Eve with some 1/2 lb lobster tails and some filets with a Balsamic Glaze. As others suggested, I added some white wine and extra parmesan cheese. It was sooooo good!!!!
This was delicious! My partner even went back for seconds. I did everything as said except i added chicken too it.
Excellent recipe. The only change was that I included leeks with the traditional onions and made the risotto in the same pan that I cooked the bacon. Will make again, for sure.

This is a fantastic “base” risotto. I make it all the time. Always start with onion and garlic, then decide at the end what I want to toss in, peas, Parmesan, leftover veg, bacon, etc. So versatile... but also amazing exactly as the recipe is written.

Excellent! As noted, the key is to cook slowly and stir the rice mixture to achieve a fabulous creamy texture. As another reviewer noted and from previous experience with Risotto I did substitute 1/2c white wine to the initial add of liquid to toasted Arborio, adds another level of flavor and it’s nice to enjoy a glass of wine while stirring the rice, bon appetit!
Delicious! Used couscous since that’s what I had on hand and still worked great! Will definitely make again!
2nd time a made it. Delicious both times!!! This time I added some chicken and it was meal in one!!!
Still trying to get it right, but tastes good
I used bell pepper instead of onion

First time making risotto, ever! Such a great recipe, and such great recommendations from others. I used shallots instead of an onion, and added in 1/4 cup of white wine, as suggested by others. And topped off with a bit of parsley. Delicious!
It was delicious! I just added a little red wine but other than that, I stuck with the recipe.

Super yummy - definitely a household favorite with us. I do skip the onions and I substitute a cup of the chicken stock with white cooking wine. I also used olive oil instead of the butter. Super good!
This recipe was good! I added a 1/4 cup of white wine and it took 7 cups of chicken broth to get the rice all the way cooked through. It also took mor like 45 minutes for all
Great recipe! I followed it exactly and it came out great!
First time making risotto and this recipe got me right through it. Tasted great. Very happy with how this came out.

I really liked this recipe! I’m a college student really just learning how to cook and this was pretty easy for me to make! I also added mushrooms to it. It was absolutely delicious! And still good as leftovers
So worth all the stirring! My family devoured this dish! Made it as written.

Of all the new recipes I've gotten from this site, this one has turned into mine (and my family's) favorite. I make it as stated with the exception of the bacon - instead of frying the bacon I just cook it in the microwave and then cut into pieces. It's near impossible to dice raw and I've not found any pre-diced bacon in the store. The first time I cooked I thought I had made a mistake because when adding the chicken stock it looks like soup! But it just takes time for the risotto to absorb the stock. Anyhow, this dish is simple and excellent. Easily a 5-star recipe.

Wow!! This recipe is fabulous! I did make a ton of changes so that’s why I gave it a four star. First off I didn’t have the rice so I googled it and exchanged the rice for basmati rice. I doubled the recipe and used 1/4 c. Parmesan cheese and 2 c. Shredded Mozzarellas cheese. I also added peas to the last broth add in, but next time I think I’ll add it at the end. Really great stuff! At the end I served it with crumbled turkey bacon. Yum!
Yummy! Poured most of the bacon grease out of the pan and sautéed some sliced mushrooms, removed them from the pan and added them back with the bacon.. ...everyone loved it!

I made this risotto exactly as written and it was too salty. The parmesan cheese is already salty, so the bacon just made it saltier. We couldn't eat it. Next, I will try this recipe without the bacon and see how it turns out.
I didn't have the fresh Parmesan so I used the spaghetti stuff. Tip for bacon: use Hormel Black Label regular cut bacon it will impart a smokiness to the dish and elevate it to a whole new level
Excellent recipe!
I was always afraid of making risotto, but this was easy and delicious. It was a big hit! Thanks for the recipe.
My family loved it. Great base to add more vegetables. Will definitely make it again.
This was great. I deglazed the bacon pan with a bit of wine and cooked the rice in that pan. I also added chopped asparagus towards the end and it worked nicely.
easy and delicious!

So good!! First timer with risotto...always assumed it would be too difficult for me to get right. Not so, turned out delicious! My pan was not deep enough though and it does need a lot of attention. I used the bacon grease instead of some of the butter, and didn't really measure the onions or garlic, but it was awesome! I made it for me to eat over several days, as I had just had dental surgery and was limited on choices. It was ALL gone within an hour thanks to 4 other members of my family that loved it:-/. This will be a keeper for my family. Is it safe to double this kind of recipe given that I have a large enough pan?

The recipe is great. I didn't like it because I think I overcooked it. It was more the consistency of oatmeal rather than creamy rice. I need to not have it on the stove for so long. I might have to get a timer to check for time. But I'll definitely try this recipe again. You pretty much can't go wrong with bacon. lol
Added the white wine. Fantastic recipe!

This risotto is fine, but needs something. I'm going to use a 1/4 cup of wine before adding the broth next time for a kick of flavor. Also, my bacon did not need to go for 10 minutes; I'm going to reduce time off the bacon so it's less crisp next time.
Phenomenal. Very flavorful. I only used 2 garlic cloves because 4 seemed like a lot. One of the best dishes I have ever made.
I added a little white wine and substituted Stilton cheese with cranberries and it came out great!

Yummo. Totally rich and decadent with an amazing flavor. I added generous portion of white wine early on I. The stirring (along with a generous portion for myself as I stirred). At the end I added frozen peas and pearl onions. Very good. Will definitely make again.

First time making risotto -- this was a good recipe to start with. Bacon and cheese cover many mistakes... I made chicken broth using Better than Bouillon and must have used too much because the rice tastes very chicken-y. I'll definitely make this again, hopefully improving my techniques!
Followed the recipe exactly! My nine year old made it and the whole family loved it!
Followed the recipe to the letter and enjoyed with beer brats. Wonderful!
Even my 3 and 4 year old eats this. Enough said.
Very easy and delicious!
very tasty
Flavor was scrumptious! My family could not get enough of this. Recipe needs no alterations.
love It! had to use white rice since my local grocer didn't sell the right rice. still good, will def be on the lookout for the right rice
This is a great recipe, but I made this with a few adjustments. I added Tri color peppers, mushrooms and chopped spinach which added a lot of flavor. Delicious!!

My husband says, "Excellent-5 stars", he never says that!
For me, I didn't really like it, maybe bc I prefer low fat meals.

Just finished eating this and it was AWESOME!!! Only adjustments were to the quantity (love the serving adjustment on this site, makes it so easy to reduce for just 1 or 2 folks). I also drizzled just a bit of the bacon fat into the butter used to saute the onions and garlic.
Will be making this again (and again) and will use some of the suggestions in other reviews like using some white wine at the beginning stages of adding the liquids.
I added tomatoes & served on lettuce for a BLT effect

LIke the video suggested, we garnished with parsley. We also deglazed the bacon with some white wine after removing some of the bacon fat, and cooked everything in the same pan. Our chicken stock was home made, though, so perhaps a little weak and thus needed to add extra salt at the end to give it some serious flavor! Overall, it was a very good recipe that we'll make again. 4 1/2 stars!
Love it! Added peas for a little green crunch. Pretty easy recipe
Declicious! I ddi not make any changes and will make it again.
Very simple and very good
First time making risotto-turned out perfect !!!!!

I followed some advice and cooked the risotto with the bacon grease, not all of about 1/3 of it and OMG, so GREAT! added some mushrooms, basil, more spices, cumin, and its is a super recipe. Thanks for the basic recipe, my family loved it!
All I have to say is love it

Really easy, especially taking the onion & garlic right into the bacon fat. Deglazed and reduced with white wine before adding the rice, which worked well. Only added butter with the parm and bacon at the end. Mm mm.

Very nice. Used about 280g bacon. Forgot to season with salt and pepper. Added a little fresh parsley at the end. Cooked the risotto in the rice cooker. Didn’t add the extra butter at the end; only the parmesan. Would definitely have this again. Thanks for a great recipe.

Followed it exactly - tasty, but very salty (the stock, I guess). BUT looking through reviews, with folk saying 'hubby went back for thirds,etc', I halved the recipe for 2 of us, but added extra rice, just in case. It STILL wasn't enough for 2. Would make again, but would use the original measures (i.e. for 4 servings!)
A favorite of my entire family. I've made it many times. Follow the directions and you can't go wrong!!! Absolutely delicious:)
I might add some chives or green onions next time and a little more garlic and onion but it was really good

One of my favorite recipes! I LOVE garlic so I added a little more garlic. Instead of onions, I used shallots. Instead of bacon, I used pancetta. Pancetta is saltier than bacon so ease up on the salt :). Also added parsley with the cheese and parsley to garnish. I tend to have to add an extra cup of chicken broth so I usually up broth to 6 cups.
It was a really good recipe. I followed it exactly. My kids say it's a keeper
It had loads of flavor, we ha it with Broiled fish, we ate it all. On the Favorites list for reuse for sure.

My fiancé said he was making steak for dinner and I decided I wanted to make a risotto. So I came up here for a recipe and since I absolutely love bacon, I had to make this one. And I have to say, anytime I'm going to make risotto in the future, I will definitely be using this one. For my first time cooking, it came out perfect and come on, who doesn't love bacon in almost anything. Great recipe!
I'm nuts for risotto. So I'll definitely make this again. I can't recall making risotto without white wine before. So, I was curious about how I'd like this. But...bacon!
Absolutely wonderful. Melts in your mouth.

Good basic recipe. I usually like adding mushrooms but I don't have any. Luckily, I have bacon. I am used to adding white wine and so I did. I also added a few herbs from the garden. This recipe is good as is or expanded with what you have on hand.
This was good, but I feel like I should have made it without cooking with the bacon grease. Too greasy and the bacon flavor is overpowering.

Risotto was really good, I doubled the parmesan but otherwise cooked it as written. It was really easy. My family loved it, there were no leftovers. My step son, who is not a big rice fan, is already asking when I'll make it again.
Tasty! I doubled the onion and added a shallot. Creamy.
Made to order with exception to using pancetta bacon. turned out slightly salty but I'm sure this was due to the pancetta. Will definitely make this again.

Great recipe. Easy to follow, turned out great! Kids ages 1-6 enjoyed/ loved this as well as me and my husband! I followed recipe exactly. I found that it was about 5 minutes per addition of broth for me. Quantity was perfect, as a side for 2 adults and 3 small kids, we had leftovers for another night. Or two. This will be added to the dinner rotation for sure, can't wait to make it again!

Basically easy and delicious. I added chopped mushrooms while cooking the rice. That was my only change. Family loved it! I paired it with Pecan Crusted Salmon from this site. Super great dinner pairing.

This is the great and easy recipe to make creamy risotto! I made some changes since I was just using ingredients from my fridges. Sausages and asparagus instead of bacon. I used brown rice which requires more broth and stirring. I used beef, and vegetables broth instead of chicken stock. Also I added some cream and cream cheese. It took almost 40~50 minutes and a lot of stirring since I used brown rice. But Brown rice is the healthier alternative. It was absolutely creamy and tasty. My husband loved it.

I selected this recipe because bacon is one of my favorite foods, and I was told risotto is the best kind of rice. I loved how the salty bacon really complimented the creamy risotto. My family loved it when I made it for them. The next night my mom made it again. Use low sodium chicken stock because the bacon makes it salty enough.

This was great. I also used wine as a like it in my risotto. Added leftover thinly sliced grilled chicken as well to make it a meal with more protein. It was excellent! Served with grilled zucchini. Will definitely make again.
This was delicious! And super easy too. My 4 year old son declared it to be the best thing in the whole world ever! The whole family loved, will certainly make again.
Yum yum yum! Made nearly identical to this except I was extra naughty and used bacon fat from the bacon as part of the butter that was called for. Yep, so bad but so so good!

Yum! As with most things, I increased the amount of garlic, parmesan, and bacon. I didn't have any onions, but the rest made up for it just fine. I also ran out of butter, so I gave a splash of milk at the end. Super creamy, super good.

Was unsure whether to try a bacon or a mushroom for my first attempt at a risotto so ended up combining them. First time I'd ever made it, first time I'd ever eaten it and both myself and my husband deemed it a success.

Will do again.
This was easily the best risotto I've ever had! I followed the recipe exactly except for adding some frozen, thawed, and drained peas. Absolutely delicious!
it tastes fine. the rice didnt get cooked all the way.
I made this last night just to try something different and my kids did not like it at all. I liked it alright but not my favorite thing. I def will not be repeating this one.

I told my husband to find a recipe that used rice, chicken broth, and bacon, and this is what he found. It was AMAZING. It smelled heavenly when I got home from work, and it tasted divine. This will definitely be repeated!
Delicious and easy ;)

The whole family really enjoyed it. The modifications that I made, however: 1 cup of white wine, in substitute for 1 cup chicken stock; Romano cheese instead of parmesan (all I had); added a few thyme sprigs along with the aborio rice. Use your own judgement on cooking time, as it will vary. Wait until it's nice and tender!
So delicious))) it was my first risotto and my family loved it... In fact they asked me to make it again)) thank you for the recipe

I made it with some of the suggestions in the comments as well. My first time making risotto and it turned out great! I sautéed the onions and garlic in the bacon grease, then I added about a 1/8 cup of wine wine just before I added the parmesan and bacon. I made the full serving size even though there was just 2 of us and there ended up being only about a cup leftover with this as our main course.
I made the dish without any changes. It was very good
Loved this. Added broccoli and it was a complete and delicious meal. No leftovers. Very easy to make.
This recipe was amazing! I didn't make any changes, followed the instructions to the t and it turned out wonderfully. Next time will half the onion though, just for my personal tastes.

I don't rate many recipes here but had to say that I made this the other night as a side dish for some chicken that I made and I made it as it was written and it was a huge hit !! in fact the risotto was gone in a matter of minutes !! this is a keeper and will make again with NO changes !! why mess with perfection !
I substituted turkey bacon and it was the best !!
Added peas, fresh tomato, basic and chopped almonds. Delicious!
